name: Loews Don CeSar Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed this past weekend 9/9-9/12...great service, everything was VERY clean even though this hotel is very old. Like other reviewers yes I agree the rooms are small, but really how much time do you really spend indoors?? The beds were very comfortable, the wait staff was friendly and food by the pool was good (Laura was awesome!!) The main lobby bar was great, (Tyler you were awesome even though you were super busy, thanks for the great Cream Soda!) I think overall the hotel is a bit overpriced but a pleseant stay and worth the trip. The only negativs for me were the ery slow elevators and the fact that pets are allowed.
reviews.title: Expensive hotel but beautiful beach and pools...!!

reviews.text: Spa Oceana hasn't been open long, but it's definitely become one of my favorite places. Try to get the first appointment of the day and you will have the steam room all to yourself. Also, if the weather is nice request a rooftop cabana and have lunch. You will get a great view of the Gulf of Mexico and beautiful hotel property.
reviews.title: Spa Oceana - Peaceful escape

reviews.text: Me & my friend(father of the bride) shared a 2 bed room on 4th floor partly facing beach. From the time we checked-in Friday afternoon, the room was so warm it took overnite to cool down. Therefore we were sweating that nite going to the rehearsal dinner party even after our showers. The internet never worked thruout our stay even after providing us a signal booster. Took 2hrs to get copy of "Father of the Bride speech" printed where we have to go to wedding organizer's office in basement of building. Coffee maker wasn't working right either, you have to press power 2x or 3x to stay on.
reviews.title: NON-Luxury weekend stay, only price was literally expensive!

reviews.text: The worst part of stay was when we were awaken by loud pipe noise from our bathroom at about 4:30am (got it on video) even hotel personnels who went and checked it can hear it from the hallway. Just what you need for your sleep after a late wedding soiree Saturday nite.
reviews.title: Nice hotel (but expensive); beautiful beach and pools

reviews.text: Took about an hour to get transfered to another 2 bed room on 2nd floor and we were promised both rooms will not be disturbed or inconvenienced. And that front desk was duly noted so that we'll have late checkout. About 10:45 am while one of us was using bathroom on 2nd floor, to our shock ... the room was opened by new guests!
reviews.title: Awesome!
Don weekend escape!
reviews.text: Having stayed at the Don Cesar numerous times, this is my first review. It is a beautiful hotel with alot of history behind it. We were upgraded to a full gulfview suite, which was much nicer than the "average rooms". Lots of space, great bathrooms and comfortable beds. The view was good, but only a window, no balcony. There are very few rooms with balconies. Construction is going on with a new addition, but since it was the weekend, no workers were there, so we did not have the noise issue as some previous post. The drinks in both the inside and outside bars are really good, but the pricese are steep, so be prepared for that. I don't think there is anything cheap at the Don! Staff was friendly in all areas. My biggest complaints are the following: It would appear that many more people use the pool facilities than are staying at the resort. By 9:00 a.m. all seats around the pool/beach area are pretty much take either by live persons or towels, books, etc on the chairs. We noticed a great number of chairs that no one ever really used during the day. Lots of people were looking for places to sit, but no luck as the day progressed. Lots of pool side attendants, but they really didn't offer any help in locating chairs that were not being used. My suggestion would be they find a better way of monitoring that situation. There is nothing that prevents people from walking from the beach area, or off the street for that matter, and using their facilities. The outside bar does a brisk business, so maybe they don't discourage the outside use, as long as you buy their drinks!!!!! I've never been blown away for the food, but it seemed this time the breakfast buffet was way over priced and left alot to be desired. That was the only meal we ate there. Great places for breakfast are Skidders and Frog Pond. Lots of food and way cheaper. We prefer the Beach House if you like a more laid back time and prefer cooking your own meals, etc. Overall not a bad experience just pricey.

My wife and our two boys (5 and 2) stayed at the Don 7/30/07 - 8/3/07. We have stayed at many 4/5 star hotels across the US and Caribbean and I have to say that the Don ranks close to the top of our list.
reviews.title: First Class Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading several mixed reviews on this and other sites, I was slightly concerned about the hotel prior to arrival. All of my concerns were erased the moment we walked into the hotel. Every single employee at the hotel we spoke with was professional. Most of them had our name memorized within minutes of checking in. This is not a small hotel so I'm blown away how the bellmen remembered it each time they greeted us.
reviews.title: Great stay the week of July 23rd.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite that was not cheap, but also not that expensive compared to the likes of the Ritz, Bellagio, or even a basic hotel room in San Francisco. It was big for hotel standards - 620+ sq. feet with a living room/wet bar area and separate bedroom/bathroom. We used the pull out sofabed for our oldest son and they brought up a pack and play for our youngest that we set up in the living room. The room was a perfect setup for the four of us.
reviews.title: be open

reviews.text: The amenities were just perfect - all around. From the two large outdoor pools...one 3-4ft deep for kids and one 5-7ft deep for adults...they were perfect. A large outdoor bar/restaurant located between the pools is perfectly situated. The beach is steps away from both pools and beautiful. There's also great poolside and beachside service available.
reviews.title: Absolutely Disgusting!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me start by saying...this is going to be long, but very detailed...i am a HOTEL LOVER!! I am active duty in the military but also work in a hotel part time while I pursue my Masters degree in Hospitality Mgmt...so needless to say once again I am a HOTEL LOVER!! I love luxury and picked this hotel for a one night stay on July 17 because despite the reviews here (which I will admit I got a little worried about after booking my reservation) I knew that the luxury Don Cesar would provide me would be worth EVERY penny. Me and my boyfriend are both in the military and we are both deploying for 6 months to Iraq, it was also his birthday so I wanted to plan something EXTRA special and romantic and the Don Cesar staff went ABOVE and BEYOND EVERYTIME!! I'll start off by telling you my plan for events...I booked us originally a standard room but after reading the NUMEROUS reviews about how small the rooms are, I upgraded to a bayside Junior Suite ( well worth it!), I also scheduled us for a couples instructional massage ( yes they teach you how to massage each other it was phenomenal) at the spa. I planned for us to have a private dinner with a table set for two at a secluded location and a birthday cake I had made at cakesbycarolynn delivered to our room after dinner. So I will start off with what made this HOTEL and this STAFF the most romantic day of my life HANDS DOWN! Reminder everything was a surprise for my boyfriend.
reviews.title: The most romantic hotel EVER!

likes.liked: — The Staff, the luxury, the LOCATION

reviews.text: Pulling in to the Don Cesar visually is overwhelming beautiful, we got there at 11:45 for a 12:00 Spa appt and valet greeted us with a big smile and options for parking. He said we could either valet for $20 or self park which is included in our rate ( we selfed parked) but I thought it was great he gave us the option.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere!

reviews.text: I walked to the most smilest ( is that a word..lol) front desk of ANY hotel I have ever visited. Laketa and Jon ( i think he was the front desk supervisor) were so nice and we had small talk for a bit while that checked me in. I had coordinated my stay and private dinner with the Guest Services Coordinater Ron and they called him and he greeted me and my boyfriend at the front desk. Ron is the GREATEST, very busy man and I was grateful that he took time out to personally greet me and my man. Our room wasnt ready that early of course, but I knew it wouldnt be thats why I made the spa appt for the time I did. Ron walked us down to the Spa where we were greeted by Yet ANOTHER welcoming staff member who told us, he has a "better room ready for us, while they get everything ready upstairs". Me and my love changed into our spa robes and were introduced to the lady with the MAGIC hands MARY! She was wonderful, and took her sweet time showing us how to massage each other, I got aromatherapy with lavender and my man got massaged with sports heating oil. The best massage I have EVER received, imagine getting rubbed down by two people for 30 mintues!! Cant get no better than that! After sitting in the Sauna we finally left the Spa at 3pm...and guess who was waiting for us to show us to our room RON! Ron escorted us to our suite and first impression HEAVENLY!!! I actually thought they upgraded us after reading all the reviews here I was expecting some tiny cramped room, but no...the music was playing, the ceilings were blue, the bathroom had TWO...yes TWO sinks and the bed looked, felt heavenly...he gave us a quick run down of the room and told us that he had two chairs reserved for us at the swimming pool if we wanted them...Ron sure does know how to think of the little things!! He gave us two coupons for the ice cream parlor and we decided to grab something light to eat at the Sea Porch Cafe. Which of course was great!! I had a Margerita Pizza and my boyfriend also had some type of meat lovers Pizza, it was delicious...we then went to the Ice cream parlor and spoke to another great staff member who let us pick ANYTHING we wanted from the menu...I know this might seem like a great contrast from others reviews, but people Im telling you I got nothing but great SERVICE...and there is EVEN more. We went down to the pool and Heather our waitress was very attentive, my goal was to sit at the pool, soaking up the sun and drink some "fufu" drinks and that is what she did for us. All you had to do was stick up a white flag and she came with a smile waiting to take our order.
reviews.title: Not worth the money
horrible experience
reviews.text: I had the private dinner scheduled for 8pm on a terrace overlooking the beach so that we could view the sunset, and Ron had a coincerge Jeremy greet us at our our room and escort us to our dinner. I think my man almost cried it was sooo beautiful...imagine stepping on a terrace, sun setting, a personal waiter, music playing, dinner set for two, with rose petals EVERYWHERE, candles and champagne! GORGEOUS, GORGEOUS, GORGEOUS!! We went down to the lounge with the piano bar afterwards and had drinks, then went up to the room, where his birthday cake awaited us!! Not only that, but I had a romance package so we had wine, chocolate, cookies, milk and they even threw in some white chocolate covered strawberries!!! All this was waiting for us when we got into our room!! The romance package came with Breakfast in Bed in the morning, I ordered it around 8am and we got it about 20 minutes later...so the point of this wonderful story is the staff at Don Cesar make it wonderful. Every staff member that passed us greeted us and asked us how our stay was going and this hotel is VERY military friendly as you can see. This is officially our spot and I wouldnt be surprised if my man didnt try to pull a slick one and ask me to marry him here next year..The Don and its Staff will ALWAYS have a special place in my heart and I wil think of that day for the next 6 months while I am away in the middle east fighting for my country...thanks Ron, Mary, Laketa, Jeremy, Heather, and every member of the staff..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had rented 3 (extremely tiny) rooms through hotels.com at a very expensive rate, thinking that the convenience of staying in the same hotel as a special family event would outweigh the cost. Not so! It began with the long line of cars at registration - valet parking was full. We couldn't get near the pool bar, which was the only place (until 5:00) to get any food. I had requested our rooms be near each other - they were as far apart as possible, though on the same floor,
reviews.title: Don CeSar July Fourth

likes.disliked: — Overcrowded pool, large numbers of children, having to get up at 6:30 to get a seat at pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have lived in St Pete for 5 years and finally went and stayed 2 nights in May for my birthday. Unfortunately I think I expected too much as I ended up disappointed and probably won't stay again. First, room was not ready when we arrived at 4pm (which is check in time) - we had to wait at least 45 minutes for room. So we went to the bar - which was difficult to get to because a wedding party had overtaken the entire bar area for their pictures. They were glaring at us like we were crashing their party?! Then waited at least 15 minutes to get waited on at the bar...things were not starting off very well. Finally got our room and was disappointed as it was TINY and we had a lovely view of the...roof! I could not believe we paid what we did for it.
reviews.title: Kinda Disappointed

reviews.text: The other disappointments: extremely small and slow elevators, no availability of chairs at the pool (every one was taken by the time we got there at 9am, ugh). So we had to get chairs on the beach which was fine but we were kinda hoping to get pool chairs. Pools areas were crazy crowded and loud. And the weddings and wedding party crowds were out of control all weekend (mulitple weddings)- they completely take over the hallways, elevators, pool areas, etc.
reviews.title: transportation for guest

reviews.text: The highlights: comfy bed, breakfast that was delivered to room (yum), and the beach.
reviews.title: Don CeSar ~What a pleasant surprise~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, disappointed :-(
reviews.title: They take dogs !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Don as part of a large group. After spending the day by the pool the Don ( which was great by the way ), we were referred by the bellman to freebeachride.com which they called for us. There were 12 of us . Upon their arrival we asked our driver for a happening place for dinner with live entertainment and good food . Off we went to a place called Seahags. Could not have had a better time. Upon finishing our meal , our host called free beach ride and free beach ride returned us to our resort safely. We were grateful given the size of our group we were all able to travel together .Thank you free beach ride and taking such care of us.
reviews.title: Pampered Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were so thrilled when we booked our honeymoon....looking so forward to a week of sun and relaxation. My husband chose Luxury Link to book our hotel reservations at the Don Cesar Resort and Spa, Saint Pete Beach, Florida. With this option, (to book online through a third party vendor) you pay up front and everything is taken care of when you arrive, except for incidentals, of course. Our flight was great, our convertible car was ready when we arrived at the airport..everything was happening beautifully. We pulled into the Don Cesar early...around 12:00 noon on Friday, June 15th. Realizing we were very early, we checked our baggage with the front staff and checked to see if our room would be available anytime soon. Parker, the front desk clerk assured me that if we would go out to the beachside bar, our room would be available "shortly". It sounded like positive information and since we had let the Parker (the front desk clerk) know that we were several hours early and that we were on our honeymoon AND that we were very anxious to check in and get our suits on to go out and enjoy the ocean.......he may possibly find it within himself to periodically check on the availability of our room and give us a reasonable time frame of when our room may be ready. So, here we go: 12:00 noon- check in, check baggage and agreeably head out to the beach bar to have a few cocktails and lunch (per the front desk clerk's suggestion). 2:00 pm- We thought by now, our room is probably ready....the front desk clerk assured us at 12:00 noon that the room was being cleaned and it would be ready "shortly". We had spent 2 hours in our travel clothes (from our flight) outside in the heat spending well over $200 on overpriced appetizers and cocktails at the poolside bar/restaurant. We were dying from the heat and anxious to get our honeymoon started. My husband went in to check only to return and let me know that the front desk clerk said that the room was still being cleaned and would be ready "shortly". I am starting to get frustrated. I start thinking to myself "If the room is not ready and will not be ready anytime soon....just tell me the truth so I don't get my hopes up". My anxiousness is getting elevated, nonetheless, we opt to spend another hour outside in the heat.....waiting for the word on our hotel room that we booked months ago. 3:00 pm.- I can no longer stand the heat so we head inside. I thought to myself if we sit at the chairs directly in front of Parker and the other front desk clerks, they will remember that we have already been waiting for three hours and let us check into our room already....what a mistake! While we sat and waited...thirty more minutes pass...I make repeated requests to get into our hotel room...only to watch other guests receive their hotel room cards and be escorted off to the elevators to be let into THEIR hotel rooms. Keep in mind, our room wasn't anything special...we didn't have any special requests...a King Bed, a partial ocean view, blah, blah, blah......Why were the other guests being given their rooms and we were going on FOUR HOURS OF WAITING?? Finally, around 3:45 pm, 15 minutes short of when our room was contractually supposed to be ready, we ask to speak to the manager. We get a blank stare from Parker and are yet again reassured that the room is still being CLEANED? I think to myself...this must be the CLEANEST HOTEL ROOM EVER!!!! We are going to be eating off the floor...after all...the housekeeping crew has been cleaning OUR room for four hours according to Parker and the other front desk staff!! At 4pm, I ask ONE MORE time if my room is ready......and the answer now from the female African American desk clerk is simply....NO.
reviews.title: The Don Cesar Ruined Our Honeymoon

likes.liked: — Worst experience of my life...they ruined my one and only honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I, by this time, am livid. I also note, at this time, that there are other folks waiting for their rooms. There must have been twenty people waiting for their rooms...the only difference is they just got there....we have been waiting for over four hours. Long story short, I call Luxury Link to explain the problem. They tell me that the Don Cesar will cancel the reservation with a penalty of one night's stay. Are they CRAZY?? One night's stay....we can't even get into our room. I give the Luxury Link rep the opportunity to call the Don Cesar front desk and if my room is ready now (4:30 pm) then I will not only be happy to pay for one night...but the other seven that I have already paid for up front. The room is not ready...our honeymoon falling apart...with not such much as an apology from the Don Cesar Staff....no manager ever showed up...I think they were relieved when we left to go find another resort to stay at during our honeymoon...because this meant one less family to worry about finding a room for and one less person staring at them wondering where their room was. The staff was rude. The whole system was ridiculously uncoordinated. I would recommend anyone contemplating staying at the Don Cesar....you should call before you arrive and get a staff member to sign a contract stating when your room is guaranteed to be ready...if not, be prepared to wait and wait and wait......with nothing but a bunch of lies heading your way from people that could care less why you are there...why you spent thousands of dollars to get there and really don't care if you leave.
reviews.title: Loved the Don

likes.liked: — we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite!
likes.disliked: — Waiting for our room to be ready

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horrible experience. I wouldn't let my worst enemy stay at the Don Cesar.
reviews.title: Where's the luxury?

reviews.text: I feel compelled to write this review after reading reviews from guests who stayed at the Don the same time as I did and were not happy. My husband and I booked an oceanfront room with a balcony for 2 nights beginning 6/15. It is true that when we tried to check-in at around 1 PM our room was not ready. We did have to wait approx 1 1/2 hours for the room to be ready. Keep in mind that the hotel was sold out for that weekend. Lots of people checking in. We had lunch at the Sea Porch Cafe which was lovely and reasonably priced. When we got to our room we were stunned and thrilled to see that we had been upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. It was absolutely beautiful and the bathroom was the largest we have ever seen. Almost as big as the bedroom. We never heard any noise from other rooms.
reviews.title: Just great - will definately stay again

likes.disliked: — lack of a huge choice on menus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the beach Saturday morning at around 10 AM and there were plenty of chairs to be had. I don't know what other people are talking about when they say there were no chairs at 10 AM. Granted, the pool was definitely crowded and there were no chairs there, but there was no shortage of chairs at the beach. And they are complimentary to hotel guests. I thought the Maritana Restaurant was overpriced and pretentious. It was all about presentation. But you can choose not to eat there. The staff from bellboys (thank you, Todd), checkin (hello Parker) to the waitstaff at the Restaurants were all excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful except for crowds

likes.disliked: — Unnecssary crowds at pool and beach, due to outsiders

reviews.text: This was my second stay here, the first was Dec. '10 but we where only there for one night and didnt get to fully enjoy the resort. From the moment we arrived every need and then some was taken care of. As I already knew the rooms are a bit small compared to newer hotels but everything is layed out well and being that this is a historic hotel; rooms were just smaller whe this hotel was built. Our room was very clean and housekeeping was always very prompt. The biggest thing I greatly enjoyed was all of the little extras that this resort provides. Yes, you do pay a $22/ night resort fee but it actually goes for something, like wireless internet, parking and padded lounge chairs with umbrellas on the beach. As well as padded pool chairs, towels and umbrellas, a great fitness center with classes in the fitness room, pool and on the beach. I also enjoyed the little trats that they bring out a couple times every day like italian ice, smoothies and chilled fruit. All of this for free or at least part of the resort fee. Every employee was super nice and helpful. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: If you don't think this is luxury then You must be a real life princess

reviews.text: We have been to the Loews Don CeSar and their Beach House Suites many times along with my family as well. We always have a fantastic time! Both properties open right onto the St. Pete Beach waters making it convenient to run back to your room if you forget something. The staff there is always so accommodating and I have never experienced an inconvenience with my reservations. We love all the little shops and the ice cream parlor at the Don! The pools are exceptional. We felt so fancy when a pool boy walked over to us asking if we would like to have a cold towel while we were sun bathing. Another great service is if you are staying at either property there is a hotel shuttle driver that is always willing to take you from one hotel to the other and come back to pick you up. We visit Tampa often and this will always be our place to stay. Many memories made there!!
reviews.title: This is Our Home When Visting Tampa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband has talked about the “Pink Palace” for years, so we finally made it to St. Pete Beach and I got my first look. It is an impressive place and huge, and from the distance looks like a Spanish castle. The lobby is beautiful and stately, and we were given a very large Oceanview room with a couch and small kitchen area. They are just beginning to renovate the guest rooms, and they can definitely use it. However, even though the décor is dated, and the bathrooms are tiny, I was very happy and comfortable in the room. In fact, I commented to our bellman that I loved the ceiling fan, and he told me that the renovation plans would probably remove them. (I think all hotel rooms should have ceiling fans and told everyone at the hotel who would listen not to remove them!!) The Don did not offer a breakfast package, so it can get a little pricey if you eat breakfast there. The bar, wait staff, and the bell staff was amazing – helpful, informative and very, very welcoming. There were some very nice perqs that you don’t often see such as free Internet and free self-parking. There were a few negatives…..we checked in on the Sunday of Labor Day weekend, so on that Monday as the hotel pretty much cleared out, the housekeeping staff was overwhelmed and they never serviced our room. I mentioned it to the young ladies cleaning the rooms on our floor, but it did never got done. (Granted, I did not call Housekeeping to specifically request service.) On Tuesday, we saw a Housekeeping Manager and mentioned it, and the room was eventually serviced. Another thing we could not understand is why they left the beach chairs and cushions out in a tropical storm-type rainy weekend. The canopied bed shelters with gauzy white material for sun protection looked ragged and wind-blown, and the cushions on all of the chairs were disheveled, ripped and soaked. There was no visible beach staff that I could see. The beach amenities did not match the luxury and classy feel of the rest of the grounds. All of that being said, I fell in love with the Gulf and will most definitely return to the Don.
reviews.title: A Classy Old Girl

reviews.text: This was the worst waste of money at a hotel EVER for me and my family. The service was terrible. They didn't even clean our room Saturday night of our stay...GROSS! That is absolutely unacceptable, we had to bathe our baby in a dirty bathtub! The rooms are very small, and we stayed in a Grand room, and everything is so expensive. The beach is nice but they don't clean up the lounge chairs out there at all so they get to be pretty dirty. They are in the middle of a renovation so there are a lot of areas that are off limits. I don't mind paying extra for exceptional service but the service was subpar to be nice. I won't be back and am truly disappointed that we chose the Don Ce Sar for our family trip.
reviews.title: The only luxury thing was the price

reviews.text: Wished I could have stayed longer -- had business in St Pete with one day free so I booked at the Lowes -- glad I did. I spent a whole day just hanging on the beach reading, at the pool drinking, lounging in the room and in the restauraunt. The poolside bar is fun, the beach nice. The hotel is an old fashioned resort type structure but in excellent shape and well-appointed. The staff from top to bottom were friendly and helpful. I would love to stay there longer.
reviews.title: Lazy sunny retreat

reviews.text: Although we were allowed to check-in one hour early, things went downhill from there. The toilet in our room was stopped up, the door of the room did not close all the way without being pulled closed and housekeeping would leave to door open after cleaning the room. Many of the scheduled activities changed or were canceled completely. The Don Cesar advertised fireworks for the fourth of July that they did not give; we watched fireworks given by other hotels. They promised refreshments but only gave us water. Advertised Wi-Fi cost $11 per day.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: The Don Cesar is a nice place, the staff was great, the beach was great, etc. I would prefer a Marriott, Hyatt, or Embassy Suites, though because of the style of the hotel. I prefer a more modern hotel. And of course, as with just about EVERY higher end hotel, they charge for internet. Hotels charging more than 75% less per night provide internet at no charge! The hotel industry needs to wake up in this respect. Oh yeah, and watch out for the $7 bottled water in the room...
reviews.title: Nice place, just not my type of place

reviews.text: We did have to wait until 4 pm to check in. We did not warn the hotel we would show up at noon, just went there. We ended up walking around and then going to Hurricane's for lunch a little south of there (best grouper sandwiches I have ever had, and I've sampled a few).
reviews.title: Old-fashioned elegance

likes.liked: — Old fashioned elegance and no neon......

reviews.text: Our rooms were ready at 4 pm and they were the same clean, nicely appointed rooms I remember from years ago. Check-out was noon, so maybe that has something to do with it.......housekeeping was great.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed mid-week, which I recommend. It was not overcrowded and we didn't have any weddings to put up with.
reviews.title: Fell in Love with this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the last 5 years I have stayed three times in the Don Cesar Main House, and I am writing this review 1 1/2 years later since the last time we were there. I once stayed in the detached Suites, because I brought my pets .There is no comparison between the two btw. I would not stay in the detached building again, not worth the money, I must say, because I was anticipating similar accommodations like in the Main Building, I was really disappointed. The main house, however, is a different world. I can only assume, that the reviewers who gave this property one point rating, did NOT stay at the Main House..... It is elegant, beautiful Spanish Old Worlde, gorgeous pool & beach, fantastic bar, superb Restaurant and incredible vistas from beautifully and tastefully decorated rooms (it's worth the Oceanfront upgrade). I must say, that the rooms are rather small, so was our balcony, each time I stayed here. There is a lot of history to this place, it is THE landmark of the region and you can see it's majestic structure far away in approach to St Pete Beach. I did use the Spa Services each time I stayed here and have no complaints whatsoever. It is a beautiful and well maintained property with outstanding service. First Class all the way, and for the previous reviewers who gave it ONE POINT... I have no idea where they get such negative feedback from. Maybe you are confusing this property with another one...... And yes... it's Loews.... what did you expect... Days Inn rates?
reviews.title: Best place to stay in St Pete Beach

reviews.text: Upon arrival the hotel was beautiful. The rooms are small. Nothing special. The elevators are slow and some are not working. The parking situation is odd. The Internet at the hotl (in many different areas) does not work well. I was not impressed with the pool. Don't get me wrong the place is decent, but for this price I expect the ritz
reviews.title: Don't understand why this hotel is so 'great'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful. It looks very spanish style. The staff is very professional and hospitable. On the other hand that prices were crazy. It is nice if you are looking to spend a fortune, but I don't know if the quality was worth the price. The location was kinda not near anything so it was about a thirty minute drive from everything. I think it would be great for like a romantic getaway but not for like vacationing and attractions.
reviews.title: st pete

reviews.text: We stayed at the Don Cesar last year for 5 nights. The rooms were lovely and very clean. The hotel is well kept and has a great pool area leading onto the beach. The most noticeable thing about the hotel apart from it's looks (very pretty hotel!) was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone we spoke to made you feel so welcome, from the doorman to the waiter who brought tea to our room! If I could give thi hotel more than 5 out of 5 for service I would!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: I had booked this incredible stay with Living social so it was a great price for the stay. My only thing was when i checked in I wasn't given the book with all the features of the hotel like other were getting. My friend was a little miffed when he found out.
reviews.title: Birthday Weekend

description: The Loews Don CeSar Hotel is a 4 Diamond hotel in St. Pete Beach, boasting an elegant beachfront location with stunning views of the Gulf of Mexico. Guests can relax in one of 277 luxurious rooms and suites, pamper themselves at Spa Oceana, or enjoy the sun at 2 beachfront pools at this luxury resort.
